Dear Ms. McBride:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
12/07/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-552-3662.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
Rule 400.4146 Immunizations
(1) A resident shall have current immunizations
as required by the department of community
health.
One of two youths was admitted on 2/6/23 with six overdue vaccinations. The
facility was to have commenced immunizations no later than 3/8/23.
2

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• I clarified with the social service worker that treatment plans should not be printed
and signed at the beginning of the period under review. Rather, they should be
printed and signed at the end of the timeframe so all of the information within that
timeframe pulls from the data system into the report. Social service worker
should also be sure that the youth's progress toward each identified goal is
documented in the updated treatment plans.
• I explained that immunization records (MICR) should be accessed, printed and
placed in the youth's files within 30 days of admission. If, at the time of
admission, immunizations are overdue, the facility must see to it that the youth is
vaccinated immediately unless contraindicated by a physician or the youth's
parent/guardian objects to required vaccines on religious grounds.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Ideas for corrective action to achieve compliance for R 146 (1) were discussed.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were identified.

N/A

There were no investigations during this review period.
3

Staff and Youth Interviews
Lead staff asked for consultation re: programming ideas for an 18-year-old who
already graduated from High School. Youths reported no concerns and are content
with the program.
Description of Agency Walk Through
I observed the kitchen, dining room, bedrooms, pantry and medication cabinet.
The facility is clean and organized. Activity schedules and meal menus are posted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
